title: Retro Disco Fashion
description: Boogie back to the dance floor and test your knowledge of the glittery, glamorous fashion of the disco era!

questions.question: What type of wide-legged pants, flaring dramatically from the knee, were the essential disco dance floor pants?
questions.explanation: Bell-bottoms, with their extreme flare from the knee down, were the quintessential disco pants, swinging dramatically on the dance floor.

questions.question: What shiny, reflective fabric was used to make the most iconic disco shirts and dresses?
questions.explanation: Lame, a metallic fabric that shimmered under the disco ball, was the go-to material for disco-era clothing, catching and reflecting every light on the dance floor.

questions.question: What men's shirt style, often in polyester with a wide collar worn open to the chest, was the classic disco top?
questions.explanation: Wide-collared, open-to-the-chest polyester shirts were the signature disco men's look, often worn with gold chains visible in the open neckline.

questions.question: What men's jewelry accessory, worn around the neck over an open shirt, was essential for the disco look?
questions.explanation: Gold chains, often with a medallion or Italian horn pendant, were the essential disco-era men's accessory, worn against the chest with an open shirt.

questions.question: What type of high-soled shoes allowed disco dancers to look taller and more dramatic on the dance floor?
questions.explanation: Platform shoes with thick soles (sometimes 4-6 inches high) were the iconic disco footwear for both men and women, adding height and drama.

questions.question: Which 1977 movie, starring John Travolta, defined disco fashion with its famous white suit scene?
questions.explanation: Saturday Night Fever (1977), with John Travolta's iconic white three-piece suit on the illuminated dance floor, defined the look of the disco era.

questions.question: What clingy, stretchy one-piece garment became a popular disco outfit for women in the late 1970s?
questions.explanation: Jumpsuits, often in shiny fabrics with wide legs and deep necklines, were a popular disco outfit that made a dramatic statement on the dance floor.

questions.question: What iconic New York City nightclub, open from 1977 to 1986, was the epicenter of disco fashion?
questions.explanation: Studio 54 was the legendary disco where the most outrageous and glamorous disco fashions were on display nightly, from celebrity designers to everyday dancers.

questions.question: What shiny, form-fitting women's top, often worn without a bra, was a daring disco fashion choice?
questions.explanation: Tube tops, halter tops, and wrap tops were all popular disco-era choices for women, often made in shiny or metallic fabrics for maximum dance-floor impact.

questions.question: What fabric treatment made disco-era clothing sparkle and catch the light of the disco ball?
questions.explanation: Rhinestones, sequins, and glitter were all used extensively on disco clothing to create maximum sparkle under the mirrored disco ball.

questions.question: What style of men's trousers, featuring an extremely high waistband and wide legs, was the classic disco bottom?
questions.explanation: High-waisted, wide-legged trousers were the classic disco men's pants, often in white or bold colors, paired with platform shoes and wide belts.

questions.question: What type of wrap dress, designed by Diane von Furstenberg in 1974, became a disco and everyday fashion sensation?
questions.explanation: Diane von Furstenberg's jersey wrap dress, introduced in 1974, became one of the most popular dresses of the decade, perfect for both office and dance floor.

questions.question: What disco-era hairstyle for men involved a tightly permed, voluminous curly look?
questions.explanation: Many men, inspired by the natural Afro hairstyle, got perms to achieve big, curly hair for the disco era, creating a voluminous look.

questions.question: What style of very short, tight-fitting shorts became a fashion trend during the disco era?
questions.explanation: Hot pants, extremely short and tight-fitting shorts, were a daring disco-era fashion for women, often made in shiny or metallic fabrics.

questions.question: What color three-piece suit did John Travolta's character Tony Manero wear in the iconic dance scene of 'Saturday Night Fever'?
questions.explanation: Tony Manero's white three-piece suit in 'Saturday Night Fever' became the most iconic disco outfit of all time, widely imitated at discos across America.
